com4j

Class DefaultedComMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • com4j.DefaultedComMethod

  • public class DefaultedComMethod
extends Object
    ComMethod that calls default methods.

    This is used so that the user can do foo() whereas the real COM method invocation goes like foo().bar().zot().

    Author:
    Kohsuke Kawaguchi

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The parameter indexes of default parameters.

    • Field Detail

      • method

        protected final Method method
        The Java method that corresponds to the native COM method

      • defaultParameters

        protected final Object[] defaultParameters
        The array of default parameters of the COM methods
        See Also:
        defaultParameterIndex

      • defaultParameterIndex

        protected final int[] defaultParameterIndex
        The parameter indexes of default parameters. Each position in this array corresponds to a position in defaultParameters

        Example

        Let's assume the following values: 
          defaultParameterIndex = {2, 4};
  defaultParameters = {new Integer(3), "Hello"};
        In this example the second parameter of the ComMethod has a default value of new Integer(3) and the forth parameter has a default value of "Hello".

        See Also:
        defaultParameters

        Converts the parameters to be more native friendly.
        Parameters:

      • generateDefaultParameters

        protected void generateDefaultParameters(UseDefaultValues defValues)
        Generates the default values for this ComMethod using the given UseDefaultValues annotation
        Parameters:
        defValues - the annotation containing the information to generate the default values.
